summary.name: summary
summary.value: Zend_View/Zend_Loader try to fopen files which do not exist

description.name: description
description.value: It seems that Zend_View with Zend_Loader try to fopen view helpers from every include path, without cehckinf if the file really exists. This is the debug output I get with Zend Debugger within the profiler: {code} Debug Warning: /Rofl.to/library/Zend/Loader.php line 160 - fopen(/var/www/projects/rofl.to/application/modules/clips/views/helpers/Placeholder.php) [function.fopen]: failed to open stream: No such file or directory Debug Warning: /Rofl.to/library/Zend/Loader.php line 160 - fopen(/var/www/projects/rofl.to/application/modules/default/views/helpers/Layout.php) [function.fopen]: failed to open stream: No such file or directory (repeats 10 times) {/code} And I don't know if that is in conjuction with that, but Zend_Loader itself takes about 500ms execution time, while PluginLoader still takes 280ms. Thats a sum of about 880ms, which is really a bad thing.

value.name: Zend_View
value.description: View portion of the ZF MVC

value.body:
This is due to the implementation of Zend_Loader::isReadable(), which uses fopen() with the third argument specified (search include_path flag). This solution was chosen as it's faster than looping over the include_path manually and performing an is_readable() check.

We may refactor this in the future, but for now, this is the most performant solution.
